question: 物
sourceAnswer: thing/object/article/stuff/substance | one's-things/possessions/property/belongings | things/something/anything/everything/nothing | quality | reason/the-way-of-things | used-to-emphasize-emotion,-judgment,-etc./used-to-indicate-a-common-occurrence-in-the-past-(after-a-verb-in-past-tense)/used-to-indicate-a-general-tendency/used-to-indicate-something-that-should-happen | item-classified-as-.../item-related-to-.../work-in-the-genre-of-... | cause-of-.../cause-for-... | somehow/somewhat/for-some-reason | really/truly
sourceMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well. Besides <vocabulary>thing</vocabulary>, it has the related meanings of <vocabulary>object</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>item</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word is made up of a single kanji, it should use the kun'yomi reading, but you haven't learned it yet. Here's a mnemonic to help you:

What game has the most <vocabulary>thing</vocabulary>s in it? <reading>Mono</reading>poly (<ja>もの</ja>). You can choose from a bunch of random things to play as, you know? And no one actually knows what those things are. What's a thimble anyway? Just call it a thing.
